questions.question_text:
You have a web app that runs in Azure.

You need to identify the amount of time it takes for web pages to load in a user's browser.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It's B: Azure Application Insights is a feature of Azure Monitor that allows to monitor running applications, automatically detect performance anomalies, and use built-in analytics tools to see what users do on an app.
I made it. I will be back after the exam.

A- Incorrect: Alerts help you detect and address issues before users notice them by proactively notifying you when Azure Monitor data indicates there might be a problem with your infrastructure or application.
B-Correct: Azure Monitor Application Insights, a feature of Azure Monitor, excels in application performance monitoring (APM) for live web applications.
C-Incorrect: Log Analytics is a tool in the Azure portal to edit and run log queries from data collected by Azure Monitor logs and interactively analyze their results.
D-Incorrect: Network Watcher enables you to monitor and repair the network health of IaaS products like virtual machines (VMs), virtual networks (VNets), application gateways, load balancers, etc. Network Watcher isn't designed or intended for PaaS monitoring or Web analytics.

The correct answer should be "B" because: Network Watcher enables you to monitor and repair the network health of IaaS products like virtual machines (VMs), virtual networks (VNets), application gateways, load balancers, etc. Network Watcher isn't designed or intended for PaaS monitoring or Web analytics.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/network-watcher/network-watcher-overview
'High Availability' is correct.
"Reliability" is not part of the MS cloud computing vocabulary
Reliability is the ability of a system to recover from failures and continue to function. It's also one of the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

Availability refers to system uptime, or when the system is available to users/other applications. High Availability simply means that system is designed to run for a very long period of time. So in the context of this question, if a service failure were to happen you can give cloud resources via high availability to prevent mission critical applications from failing.

comments.content: Did you see other questions from here on the test? Can you please give examples if you did see any similar questions?

discussion.content: This question was on my exam today. 8/31/2023

Selected Answer: A
'A. APIs' is correct.

Selected Answer: A
'A. APIs' is correct.

ANSWER: A
C& D are out as thet are run by people, not by desktop applications. A desktop application does not decide which scrip to use, people do.
A- Correct-The underlying purpose of APIs is always the same: to let one piece of software communicate with another.
B-Incorrect-ARM template - A JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) file that defines one or more resources to deploy to a resource group, subscription, management group, or tenant.
C-Incorrect-The Azure command-line interface (Azure CLI) is a set of commands used to create and manage Azure resources. The Azure CLI is available across Azure services and is designed to get you working quickly with Azure, with an emphasis on automation.
D-The Azure Cloud Shell allows connectivity to Microsoft Azure using an authenticated, browser-based shell experience that’s hosted in the cloud and accessible from virtually anywhere as long as you have access to your favourite browser

Selected Answer: A
The question talks about an application so its a program and need to connect programatically
The question is really not worded well. You can potentiall use majority of the answers but generally you should use API's on 443 ideally.

Selected Answer: B
it should be azure resource manager
Chatgpt: To interact with Azure and manage resources from a desktop application, the best option is A. APIs.

questions.question_text: What should a desktop application use to interact with Azure and manage resources?

discussion.content: Today Passed with 910, Thanks to examtopics

Answer is correct: In sequence: Elasticity, Disaster Recovery and Agility are the correct answers.
Elasticity is the ability to quickly expand or decrease computer processing, memory, and storage resources to meet changing demands without worrying about capacity planning and engineering for peak usage.
Disaster recovery needs to explanation
Agility refers to the ability to deploy new applications and services quickly
In sequence: Elasticity, Disaster Recovery and Agility are the correct answers.
Got this question today - 12 Jan 2024 !
So many wrong answers in this. Agility and elasticity should be flipped.

comments.content:
Given answer is correct.
1. Elasticity ( or Scalability)
2. Disaster Recovery
3. Agility

discussion.content: Given answer is correct.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Match the cloud computing benefits to the appropriate requirements.

To answer, drag the appropriate benefit from the column on the left to its requirement on the right. Each benefit may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.

//IMG//
